comments.body:
Coming back to my other comment: With this code, if both `datacenter` and `cluster_name` is set, it will end up looping through the DC (which could have a lot of clusters, and take unnecessary time) to just discard all that info... 

It would be nice if there is a `required_one_of` and a `mutually_exclusive` in the module signature, in which case this unnecessary time would not be needed.

What happens if both `cluster_name` and `datacenter` is set? Should there be a `required_one_of` added here, and a `mutually_exclusive`?
```suggestion
        supports_check_mode=True,
        required_one_of=[['cluster_name', 'datacenter']],
        mutually_exclusive=[['cluster_name', 'datacenter']],
```
You are absolutely right. No need for `cluster_name` if `datacenter` is set.

diffHunk:

        argument_spec=argument_spec,
        supports_check_mode=True,
        required_one_of=[['cluster_name', 'datacenter']],
        mutually_exclusive=[['cluster_name', 'datacenter']],
